translation.text: Aasaa, Fifth Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਮਤਾ ਕਰਉ ਸੋ ਪਕਨਿ ਨ ਦੇਈ ॥

translation.text: Whatever I resolve, she does not allow it to come to pass.

transliteration.text: matā karau sō pakan n dēī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: She stands blocking the way of goodness and self-discipline.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

translation.text: She wears many disguises, and assumes many forms,

text: ਗ੍ਰਿਹਿ ਬਸਨਿ ਨ ਦੇਈ ਵਖਿ ਵਖਿ ਭਰਮਾਵੈ ॥੧॥

translation.text: and she does not allow me to dwell in my own home. She forces me to wander around in different directions. ||1||

transliteration.text: grih basan n dēī vakh vakh bharamāvai .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਘਰ ਕੀ ਨਾਇਕਿ ਘਰ ਵਾਸੁ ਨ ਦੇਵੈ ॥

translation.text: She has become the mistress of my home, and she does not allow me to live in it.

transliteration.text: ghar kī nāik ghar vās n dēvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. translation.text: If I try, she fights with me. ||1||Pause||

text: ਨਉ ਖੰਡ ਜੀਤੇ ਸਭਿ ਥਾਨ ਥਨੰਤਰ ॥

translation.text: but she has overwhelmed the nine continents, all places and interspaces.

transliteration.text: nau khand jītē sabh thān thanantar .

text: ਤਟਿ ਤੀਰਥਿ ਨ ਛੋਡੈ ਜੋਗ ਸੰਨਿਆਸ ॥

translation.text: She has not spared even the river banks, the sacred shrines of pilgrimage, the Yogis and Sannyaasees,

transliteration.text: tat tīrath n shōdai jōg sanniās .

translation.text: or those who tirelessly read the Simritees and study the Vedas. ||2||

text: ਹੋਛੀ ਸਰਣਿ ਪਇਆ ਰਹਣੁ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Seeking meager protection, I am not protected from her.

transliteration.text: hōshī saran paiā rahan n pāī .

text: ਕਹੁ ਮੀਤਾ ਹਉ ਕੈ ਪਹਿ ਜਾਈ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Tell me, O my friend: unto whom should I turn for protection? ||3||

transliteration.text: kah mītā hau kai pah jāī .3.

translation.text: I heard of His Teachings, and so I have come to the True Guru.

text: ਗੁਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਮੋਹਿ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: The Guru has implanted the Mantra of the Lord's Name, Har, Har, within me.

transliteration.text: gur har har nām mōh mantr drirāiā .

text: ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਵਸਿਆ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਇ ਅਨੰਤਾ ॥

translation.text: And now, I dwell in the home of my own inner self; I sing the Glorious Praises of the Infinite Lord.

transliteration.text: nij ghar vasiā gun gāi anantā .

translation.text: I have met God, O Nanak, and I have become care-free. ||4||

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਇਹ ਆਮਰਿ ਹਮ ਗੁਰਿ ਕੀਏ ਦਰਬਾਰੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ਦੂਜਾ ॥੪॥੪॥

translation.text: She is now my servant, and the Guru has made me intimate with the Lord. ||1||Second Pause||4||4||

transliteration.text: ih āmar ham gur kīē darabārī .1. rahāu dūjā .4.4.
